reviewText: I have to admit that I got hooked on this series during Season 1.  Nothing more entertaining that watching a group of guys (mostly professionals), and their adolescent behavior over fantasy football.  Taco is a high-point of the series.  Talk about blind luck.  Sometimes I'll just sit down and watch the entire series start to finish.  Always makes me smile no matter what has happened to me that day.

Patrick Bromley, DVD Verdict --Like the majority of sitcoms in their sophomore years, The League has only gotten better in Season Two. The characters are even better developed, and the ensemble is even tighter. There's really not a weak link in the bunch, though it could be argued that Jon LaJoie's Taco exists on a different show; The League takes place in recognizable reality, but Taco doesn't live there. I recognize that's the joke of the character, but it doesn't quite work. LaJoie is not to blame. Season Two also sees the addition of Jason Mantzoukas's (Baby Mama) Rafi, a horrible human being who gets laughs every time he's on screen. Still, many of the same problems present in season one haven't yet been worked out. While writer/director/mumblecore founder Mark Duplass remains one of my favorite actors on the show, his Pete still isn't much of a character--he's just the resident smartass. At times, the episodes strain too hard to pull all of the various story threads together the way that Seinfeld used to do so well, and there's a tendency to do too many variations on the same joke as though the editors couldn't decided which one to use and instead just kept them all. But these are minor complaints, because the show is consistently funny and fun to watch.

The League continues to look good in HD, with a 1.78:1/1080p transfer that's bright and bold and solid. Detail is strong throughout, skin tones look natural and the overall quality represents an improvement over season one. The DTS-HD audio track isn't called upon to do much, but handles what is required of it very well: dialogue is clear and the (brief) theme music packs a punch. Being that the whole show has kind of a low-fi charm, the Blu-ray looks and sounds good enough that it's actually overkill in some ways. Still, it's nice to view the show the best way possible, and this disc allows for precisely that.

In addition to the option to view "extended" versions of several episodes, The League: The Complete Season Two comes with a modest but not terrible offering of bonus material. There are roughly ten minutes of deleted scenes included, which offer exactly the same kind of laughs as are present in the show and were likely just cut for time. Perhaps more enjoyable is a compilation of alternate jokes improvised by the cast (a good deal of the show is improvised), many of which are funnier than what made it in but couldn't be used because they're way too dirty. A gag reel is also amusing, once again demonstrating that watching funny people make mistakes is generally more entertaining than not-funny people, if only because they know how to build on the error. An option called "Taco Tones" allows for the viewer to jump right to Jon LaJoie's songs, which basically play out like music videos. They're funny enough, but always feel way too produced and out of place, especially given the way that LaJoie's character has been written; they're shoehorned in because, you know, LaJoie is known for writing funny songs. A five-minute faux commercial for Taco's notary business goes way past overstaying its welcome. Lastly, there's a bit with Paul Scheer doing a Bob Ross impression and showing how to paint a "Kluneberg." It has very little to do with the show, but it's a funny diversion and a chance for Scheer to be silly.

-Full review at dvdverdict.com

So I was very reluctant to watch a show based on fantasy football.  Netflix kept coming up with it as a recommended show for me every time it refreshed.  Finally one night I had nothing to do so decided to give it a shot.  All I got to say about the show is WOW.  The writers are brilliant, great character development and interactions.  Seriously one of the funniest shows I've ever seen.  It can get a little crude and raunchy at times but that's what I like.  The first season although only a mere six episodes was very well done, and left me wanting more.  Seeing as netflix had not put the 2nd season on the streaming option and their lack of bluray rentals had me opt to purchase the 2nd season.

Starting from the first episode it was brilliant and everything I was expecting after the first season.  Very intelligent yet immature at the same time.  It is rare to find a show where one character doesn't stand out from the rest as a "favorite".  From Taco's ignorant way of thinking to Dre's horrible taste and awkwardness.  The show just keeps the laughs coming and coming.  Highly recommend to anyone with a crude adult sense of humor.

This is the type of series that will make you laugh! Whether it is the true belly laugh that you just love to experience or the chuckles from inane antics of the characters in the show, every episode will have you coming back for more in the end. What I like about the show itself is that each episode can stand alone, you are not to have been required to have watched all of season one to understand what is happening in season two or even to watch season three at this point, you can simply pick up this DVD and watch all and just enjoy! For me, it is the characters that make this show memorable and this season's episodes were just amazing! You will think so two when you get the chance to watch this too!

The League returns for a second season of fantasy football hilarity.  For those who do not know, The League focuses on 5 guys from Chicago who play fantasy football together.  While fantasy football pervades nearly every aspect of their lives and the show, you do not need to know anything about fantasy football to enjoy the show.  There are plenty of people, men and women, who love the show and don't play.  Everyone can relate to the characters in one way or another, whether it is Ruxin getting caught in a lie to his wife and turning to his friends to cover for him, or Andre trying to fit in with a group that mercilessly teases him, everyone can find something to like in these characters.
One of the great things about the show is that it is only loosely scripted, which means that most of it is improved and you never know what you will get.  While you can follow the show if you haven't seen season 1, I'd highly recommend watching it first as a few things that happen this season will make more sense if you do.  However, it isn't necessary to do so.

While the extras aren't amazing, the show more than makes up for it.  If you enjoyed the show the first time around, buy it on DVD so you can watch it over and over again.  The extended episodes (about half of the season) and the few great extras make it a must have!

Disc 1
EPISODES
1. Vegas Draft - As new league champion, Andre plans a trip to Las Vegas for the draft at the MGM Grand.  One of the "out of town idiots on auto draft" quits the league and the guys must decide whether to fill the spot with Jenny or Ruxin's brother-in-law, Raffi, whom they all hate. Guest stars Chad Ochocinco
2. Bro-Lo En Cunado - Kevin tries to make up with Jenny by having an adult weekend with his boss when Taco appears at the function with one of Kevin's overzealous coworkers.  Ruxin attempts to give Sofia her monthly "terrific lady day" and Pete and Andre go to a party with Raffi.
3. The White Knuckler - Andre expands his medical practice by forming a partnership with an African-American plastic surgeon and throws a party to celebrate the merger; Ruxin volunteers to fulfill a sick child's wish, but hijacks the wish for himself; Pete dates someone who has slept with Kevin and feels awkward about their intimate past.  No extended version. Guest stars Josh Cribbs and Terrell Suggs.
4. The Kluneberg - Andre buys an expensive painting and is mocked by the guys for it; the guys try to get Raffi out of the league; Jenny meets up with an old friend that Kevin suspects is a sex addict.
5. The Marathon - Andre signs up to run a marathon, which prompts Pete to say he is going to run it too; Taco becomes a notary; Jenny and Kevin seek to balance family life when they go head-to-head in this week's matchup.  No extended version
6. The Anniversary Party - Because of Taco's meddling, Ruxin throws Sofia an anniversary party on the same day as Jenny's birthday that all of the guys attend, including someone from Pete's past who shows up with a "plus one."  No extended version
7. Ghost Monkey - Kevin tries to create an adult Halloween for the guys and Jenny, but his idea doesn't go as planned; Taco steals a monkey and fears that he killed it and is being haunted by its vengeful spirit; Pete dates a witch; Ruxin and Pete go head-to-head and Pete lets Ruxin set his line-up - a decision that Ruxin agonizes over.  No extended version

EXTRAS
Deleted Scenes - Deleted scenes from the Vegas Draft through the Ghost Monkey episode.  The deleted scenes are hit and miss.  Some of the are absolutely hilarious while others barely garner a smirk.
El Notario! - This is Taco's advertisement for his notary services South of the Border.  This skit was absolutely hilarious!  Make sure you watch the Marathon episode before watching this one.
Kluneberg Paint by Numbers - Andre as Bob Ross in the "Joy of Painting Stuff"  This skit makes fun of those old PBS painting shows.  Worth watching once, but not particularly funny.
Taco Tones Productions Presents - This is a collection of all the music videos and Taco productions from the season - I'm Inside Me, Naginta!, Sofia & Rodney's Wedding Video, and Vinegar Strokes.  I would've loved to see extended versions of what actually made the show and a full version of the Pete's Tiny Little Erect Dick song.

Disc 2
EPISODES
8. The Tie - Andre and Ruxin complain about a tie prompting Kevin to quit as league commissioner and leaving the guys to come up with alternative ways to break the tie.
9. The Expert Witness - Ruxin has a big case and turns to Andre as an expert witness; Ruxin suspects Jenny and Kevin are colluding in the league; the judge has a thing for Ruxin; Taco and the courtroom artist get intimately acquainted.
10. The High School Reunion - The guys have their 10 year reunion where Andre wants to show off his success, but his efforts are negated by Pete and Kevin; Ruxin wants to show off his hot wife; Pete wants to name the trophy after the worst person at the reunion; the origins of the Shiva Blast are revealed. No extended episode.
11. Ramona Neopolitano - The final week of the regular season begins to fray Andre's emotions; Ruxin lies to Sofia about having a dead wife; Kevin turns to fantasy football gurus to help him set his lineup.
12. Kegel the Elf - The playoffs begin to determine who is going to the Shiva Bowl; Kevin and Jenny must deal with Ellie misbehaving at school; Pete dates a single mother who just isn't ready to sleep with him and turns to Jenny for help. No extended episode.
13. The Sacko Bowl - In the season finale, Jenny and Ruxin face off in the Shiva Bowl to determine the league champion while Andre and Tako face off in the Sacko Bowl to determine the league loser.

EXTRAS
Delete Scenes - Deleted scenes from the Tie through the Sacko Bowl finale.  Like the ones on disc 1, the deleted scenes on disc 2 are hit and miss too.
Alt Nation - Since the show is improved there are a lot of takes of the same scene to try out different improvised jokes.  Here is where you will find them.  Like the deleted scenes, some are hilarious while others fall flat.
Gag Reel - All the mistakes that the guys made.  Pretty funny.

this has got to be the funniest show on cable.  season 2 was awesome.  every episode rafi was in had me dying. this is a must have.  i'm glad they signed on for a season 3.  cant wait for it to start.  my wife isn't much of a football nut but she loves this show as well.
Good ball-busting humor. I could care less about football, let alone fantasy football, but my wife and I really enjoyed this series.

If you want to summarize how funny Season 2 is, all you need to know is "Vinegar Strokes". Also, look up Jon Lajoie. Throw in even more guest spots from NFL players, and it's fantastic. But be warned, like I said, a bit on the immature side.

This is one of the rare shows that can make you laugh out loud every episode!  If you're a Fantasy Football fan, you'll love it.  If you know nothing about Fantasy Football, it's still a great watch!  The comedy is occasionally related to sports, but it's much more about the relationship between friends.

This show is the gift that keeps on giving. The mix of improv and script make for some memorable moments. And the "say anything" attitude just runs with the premise.

As others have said. It's an ultra-competitive league, but the relationships and one-upmanship are where the comedy gold is at.

If you found Archer funny at all, you'll love this show.

I've never been much of a fan of TV comedies, but as a passionate fantasy football enthusiast, I decided to give The League a chance, and I am exquisitely glad that I did, as it is a consistently and utterly hilarious, creative, and well-written show. The actors all have believable, engaging chemistry with one another and impeccable comedic timing. This is clever, raunchy male humor at its finest. I've been an ardent fan of the show since the very first episode and Season 2 is the best yet. I absolutely love The League and highly recommend it.

I was turned on to this show by my college freshman son.  As a fantasy league player, I was interested thinking it would be funny because of all the inside jokes and observations about having a fantasy team.  While it does serve as the basis of the show and certainly is referenced on occasion, fantasy football is not the primary driver.  The humor is universal.  It is more about following the character development and the relationships and interactions between the primary characters.  In short, this is one of the funniest shows I have ever watched.  The humor is not for everyone, but for those who are not easily offended by bathroom and sexual innuendo topics, this show is mostly unbeatable.

This show is packed with many funny themes, ideas and keeps a good tight storyline arc per episode.  Sometimes I have to rewind to catch the subtle jokes and gags.  All characters are easy to love and loathe at the same time.  I see a bit of myself in every episode and laugh out load.

This is a great show, even if you are not a fantasy football fan or even a football fan for that matter.  I am mid-way through season 3 right now, and I think that season 2 was the best so far.  I don't remember the last time a show had me consistently laughing out loud.

I know the title is an oxymoron, but it seems to fit well. The guys seem like normal enough, like most adult males. Like most, trying to hang on to their youth competing to win in fantasy football and anything they can find to challenge their group of friends. Season two follows the same script as season one. Same off color humor and characters, but new situations to keep me coming back for more.

I was shocked at how consistently funny this show is.  Great, adult humor. The roles are perfectly cast.  And it's available for free on Amazon Prime!
Almost as funny as season one. Definitely worth watching if you like great humor. My wife.. maybe not so much.
Such an amazing series.  I was late to work because I just couldn't stop watching it.  I am already onto Season 4.
I had caught an episode here & there, and just recently began watching all episodes beginning with season one. I love that we can do the live streaming for free with amazon prime.
Can't get enough of this gang, great price for laughter, if you need an uplift just pop the DVD in and enjoy

Each season I watch gets better. The jokes are cruder, the characters are more extreme and the story lines are funny AND believable, something that shows nowadays aside from this one and always sunny seem to deviate from. Highly recommend.

The cover, case, and cd are of superb quality. However, the contents of the cd are not so great. I am pretty sure this review isn't about the show itself - so I will leave out my hardcore thoughts. I will say that unless you don't care about the content your kid watches, this isn't a good show for anyone under 16 or so... They are crude and .... Wait I said I wasn't going to critique the show. So yeah. great quality case and cd.
Hilarious show. Stream quality was great. Going to watch all seasons hopefully this summer. Recommend. Recommend. Recommend. Sometimes raunchy but hilarious

Might be my favorite season. Great casting, despicable characters but they are such perfect charactures actual people you deal with each day or maybe it hits a little to close to home.  Great for a good laugh.
Great show. Creative, funny and entertaining. I would recommend it to sports fans and non-fans alike. I always laugh at least a few times per episode.
This show keeps getting better and better. Any guy in their 30's will immediately relate to this. Football knowledge not necessary.
This is a very funny show!  Beware the crude sexual humor though.  Adult based program with humor and football.  Plus a few NFL stars here and again

As a Fantasy Football player, myself, I enjoy the "obsession" these guys humorously illustrate in each episode. It's true how the play of the game slips into one's ordinary, personal life.  Lots of laughs!
If you like goofy buddy comedies, this is the show for you.  Based in Chicago, it follows the lives of a group of childhood friends who get together to play fantasy football.  Hilarity ensues.

Seriously, if you need something a little fun but not over the top, this is your laugh out loud moment. I've found that the ppl i watch this have started making inside jokes about this in our onw daily lives. You'll love Raphi-bombing!
A worthy follow up season. They pushed it even further in season two. Just wish they would show the standings each week.
DUMB DUMB'S EAT MEATLOAF AT HOME. MEATLOAF AT HOME IS THE SAME AS MEATLOAF IN A RESTAURANT. DON'T WATCH THESE BOZOS UNLESS YOU'RE REALLY BORED
Greatest show ever.  It missed the mark a couple episodes after season 2.  2nd season is by far the best.
The League totally kicks ass.  I wish I had a group of friends like this to constantly harass.  The end.
Just as much comedy and shenanigans as the first season but there's more interaction in their everyday lives instead of just focusing on the league.

I think that this show is really funny.  If you like the type of humor it presents then go ahead and watch it.  The language and jokes are very off color though, so be mindful of the audience you are watching it with.
This show is so over the top with male machismo- it is hilarious.  I love it.  It depicts the absolute epitome of football fanatics and the craziness that is possible within people.
This show is hilarious! Where do they come up with the crazy stuff that goes on? Awesome writing and cast.

Why is this show rated so high? I like Nick Kroll so thats why I started watching.  The first episodes are amusing, but the show fails to gain momentum.  I'm surprised this show has almost 5 stars! Am I missing something or is this really what people think is funny?  Mediocre at best.
Witty, funny and weird.  Great combination.  Made a sick day fly by.  Couldn't turn it off.  The level of raunchy innuendo was perfect.
great chemistry, great script. it kinda reminds me of entourage, but minus alot of famous celebrities. so glad I had a chance to watch this!

Really Fun show!
Streams right away and looks great on Amazon Prime in HD!
So glad they added it.
Highly recommended!

This is a really funny show. Almost every episode has something hilarious happen, and the great majority of them will have you laughing uproariously. I don't have a fantasy league, and I don't really keep up with other teams besides my city's team. However, this show requires little to no knowledge to appreciate the ridiculous humor. The only thing keeping this from a 5 star rating is that the show will occasionally slide into unadulterated potty humor. It's just that the humor usually is so clever or shocking that I didn't think they need to rely on immature humor.
Best show ever! (Well definitely one of them!). I am required to add more words but there is nothing more to say!
So funny!  Getting to know these characters better and how they interact with each other.  Not a bad episode in the entire season.

This is simply funny!!!!!!!.......It's for any fantasy footballer. I Highly recommend you watch this show. It was a suprize when I first came across it, but it quickly became a staple in my watching routine

A really great show that I can identify with and via Amazon Prime I get to catch up on seasons that I have missed.

Randy

While season 2 of The League has lost some of the humor from the first season (due to repetitive jokes) the hilarity remains. A constant state of uproarious situations and actors hitting the mark every time this season should not be missed.

We got season 1 at a garage sale, I bought season 2, my wife bought season 3. We love this show. Raunchy, funny, goofy. I am not even that big of a football fan, or even a big time fantasy football player.
Love this show! Mostly guy humor with legit FFL references... Even so, my wife thinks it's a pretty good show too.
Not As Awesome As Season 1, But It Still Has Many Great Laughs!!  Definitely Worth Watching!! Still A Must See!!
Seriously the funniest show.  The quick whips are to boot!!  And the actors have such a great banter.  A must watch!!!

Mostly depressing.  There's something about yet another show following the crass, pointless lives of white thirty-somethings...  This was funny, for a little while, when it was called 'Always Sunny in Philadelphia.'  And please stop acting like 'edgy' means funny or interesting when we all know it means lazy.

What a riot!  I'm two seasons in and  I look forward to my time catching up.  It's addicting and it's hard to stop at one episode.  I'm almost as addicted to the show as the characters are to the Fantasy League.
Great show. Season 2 is just as good as the first. Funniest stuff I've seen. Arrived damaged but the seller replaced it. Took a lil time but I'm happy overall.
Not even into football but hands down one off the funniest shows around . Don't second guess if it's worth watching . It will have you rolling all 5 seasons are great
Great show everything bout the league is great, its very funny show that is around fantasy football its definitely a must watch show.
I love this show and the second season didn't disappoint.  If you liked the first season than what are you waiting for.
If you play fantasy football, this is a must see series!  Start at season 1 and go right through them all.  Each episode is only 30 minutes.
Season 1 and 2 were great. Full of witty humor that had my wife and I rolling. Season 3 not so much. Some redemption in Season 4.
The second season fo the show picks right up where season one ended and continues to stay as funny if not more than the first!

The show definitely peeked with season 2. Season 3 and 4 are utterly lame by comparison - and filled with annoying "celebrity" cameos and NFL promotions. Do yourself a big favor - watch the first two seasons and quit while you're ahead.
This maybe the funniest series of all time. It's a must see for any fantasy football fan.  Also just some great back and forth between the characters.
I heard this series was good but I had no idea.  I think I need the other seasons as well.
Love the league. Wish it had more relevant NFL stuff that is going on during the year. Go Tampa Bay!

Funny for fantasy football fans as well as those who don't play fantasy football ... The characters are hilarious.  The show is extremely well-written.  The actors are great.  I feel like this show is underrated.  It really deserves more credit.

Love the League!  One of the funniest shows on TV.  Perfect for people who like:

Arrested Development
Curb Your Enthusiasm
Wilfred
The Inbetweeners

BEST EPISODE EVER!!!!!!
We watch "Ghost Monkey" each year and it has become a crazy family tradition.  Just love this episode!  The League itself can be really spotty, but this one is awesome!
I watched the season before buying.  I really liked the extra scenes sections or gaffe reals.  If you liked the broadcast versions then buy them.

Some of the hardest laughs I've had in quite awhile.  I was laughing so hard I missed some of the jokes.  I also was forbid from watching this while The Wife sleeps as I kept waking her up with my giggling.  This show hits my sweet spot between FFL and marriage/relationships.  I'm also a big fan of Pete Holmes podcast and just about all comedians running through this show have been on the podcast.  In particular, Jason Mantzoukas was hilarious in Season 2.

My only slight beef is this is kind of pricey for what you get.  Like many people, I love to gang watch shows.  Typically it's the quality dramas (Mad Men, The Wire, Deadwood, Six Feet Under, etc.)...with those it's 42 or 55 or more minutes an episode.  Here we're talking about 21-22 min an episode.  I basically watched this entire season in part of a day.  I guess this is nit picking.  I'll definitely watch this again.  Perhaps it's just different with comedies.
Great dvd if you're into raunchy comedy like we are! We love the cast of characters and often find ourselves being able to relate to them very well! Lots of laughs!

This show reminds me of my friends back home. We all mess with each other, but it's all in good fun, and for a good cause: the humilty of each other. This show is one of the funniest shows I've ever seen and hits home on all levels.

The League never disappoints.  It's always funny, always borderline insane, but never dull.  The characters are all guys that we've known before (except for maybe Taco) and at some point, secretly wished we were.  Between the endless jokes about Kevin and Pete, Dr. Andre No- (you can finish the rest) and Taco's hilarious parodies you always feel like you're in the league.  Season 2 has some of the best episodes and the Blu-Ray transfer is great.  Tons of extras, deleted scenes and full versions of Taco's songs make this a no-brainer for any fan of the show or someone looking to get into a hilarious comedy.
I love this show. Knocked out the entire season in 1 day. I would definitely recommend this show to anyone. GREAT!
One of the funniest shows on TV today. All the characters in the show add to each others performance. Very funny.

Along with It's Always Sunny, Archer and Wilfred FX has a lock on out there, over the top comedy. The league season after season keeps on topping itself. Just when you think that it can't get any raunchier or nastier they deliver the funny. Rafi is one of the best characters on tv hands down.
This is funny stuff. This was a Christmas present to my husband from my daughter and was a great gift.
A hilarious show about terrible friends and their fantasy football league.  Looks great on blu ray for watching any time.
I love this series, the acting is outstanding. I love the characters, and the storyline about fantasy football and what they will do to win the trophy is hilarious !!
Another great season of the League.  If you watched the first season you will enjoy this one.  The extras on the disc are also fun.
This is an awesome show!! Not appropriate for when the kids are up but perfect for a good laugh after bed time.
The second season is just as hilarious as the first season.... there are more episodes for me which means more laughs

The league is a extra funny show. Even if you don't like sports, or football, you can't go wrong with all the laughs this show offers. I really enjoy it and would suggest you check it out for yourself.
Same comments above.........hilarious situations and adult themed scenarios are the absolute best on any market in this country.  Very impressive.
Hilarious show with good extra features for anyone that is looking for a more in depth look at the show.
Hilarious.  Innovative. I am completely infatuated with this series and I have been obnoxiously recommending it to everyone I know (and/or don't know).
this show makes me want to join a fantasy football league, and drink a 12 pack of ice cold brews!
I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband and he loved it!  I would definitely buy something similar.
If you are a fantasy football fan, this a definite must-see show.  It is hilarious and has a lot of guy humor in it in addition to the football aspect!
Episodes look amazing in HD (that might not be a good thing for some of the actors). The bonus content is rather entertaining as well. 5 stars

This show is money, and the DVDs are very affordable. The show is not just for fantasy football fans, but for anyone that like a well written kinda raunchy comedy. The writers are a husband and wife, the husband was affiliated with Curb your Enthusiasm. So the writing is spot on, and of high quality. It pokes fun at married couple situations and a goofy wild group of friends that do not want to fully grow up. Great Purchase.
The League: The Complete Second Season is wonderful. It follows several friends who are all part of a fantasy football league & their hilarious and inappropriate misadventures.
I laugh so hard. It is boy humor at the zenith. If you want to see how men act and think this is dead on.

I just discovered this show recently and love it! it is so funny and over the top! You don't have to be a football fan to enjoy it.  The things the friends do and say to each other are so hilarious! There are some fall off the couch laughing episodes

We are all a bunch of Fritatas, so why not do yourself a favor and watch a great show where every episode delivers? I can't get enough of this show.  Whether you are a football fan or not (I am, wife isn't) this show makes you laugh out loud so much, you have to hit pause quite a lot to get it all in. This cast is 5-star and the writing is as creative as it gets. I've watched every episode of every season at least 3 times on average.
Love this show and now with all the extra's this is pure gold!  This season is where all the extra footage really comes into play.  Season 1 not as much
I got these 2 seasons with the hopes of killing a few hours and came away jonesing for the 3rd and 4th season's respectively.

I have never played Fantasy football but i still find the show fantastic. The characters are really funny and the situations they get themselves into are great. I got started watching on netflix and had to buy.
Not even a football fan and I really enjoy the show. Definitely crude, scatological humor but the characters are so great its really engaging
As I said in the subject line, I hate fooball but love the League. The show is hilarious. The Blu-Rays came as described and I enjoy them every time I watch.

If you love football, especially fantasy football, you'll love this series. I believe everyone who has ever played in a fantasy football league can share some common experiences with these group of guys. Taco is the man!

I have been a fan of It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia for a long time, so I saw the ads for this show quiet a bit. I am not into football at all, so I usually ignored the show and went to bed. But I liked Jon Lajoie's comedy, so decided to watch it one night. I bought season 1 and loved it. So I HAD to buy season 2. I watched the entire 2 disk set it one sitting. It is very rare for me to laugh alone. But I was howling the whole way through.

The characters are all horrible, self centered people. Then there's Taco, the 30-something "self-employed," pot-smoking friend who never knows whats going on. On the rare occasions when the show gets dry, they shove Taco it the scene for completely not-related hilarity. In one episode, he showed up at a children's playground with a 6 foot long spear and showed it off to his friends by swinging it around. In another [SPOILER ALERT], Taco took a toilet seat from a dumpster and got addicted to sitting on it, realizing the seat was made of cocaine.

All the characters bring something unique to the show. They each insult each other in their own way, but still hang out all the time. The dialog makes the show. It is all very natural sounding, like they improvise the script. I would give It's Always Sunny 5 out of 5 stars, but The League is even better. It's one of the best, most consistently funny shows I've seen.
this series keeps getting better and better with time and you don't have to be a fantasy football junkie to enjoy!
I love this show and the extended episodes on the dvd. The special features are a good extra, but I wish there was commentary on some episodes with the cast.

While being a football fan or even someone who is in a FF League helps with the enjoyment of the show you really do not have to like either to absolutely love this show. The characters and how they interact with one another is more than enough to hook you on the show. It is well written, well acted, and simply hilarious.

I downloaded The League (both Season 1 & 2) to pass time on a trans-Pacific flight, and it barely satisfied my expectation.

The characters are interesting, but the plot lines are terrible.  Definitely not what I was expecting, being a fantasy football playing 30 something.

If you find yourself in a position with nothing else to watch/do, The League will suffice.  I'd just advise looking a little harder for something more interesting.
Must watch! So funny, I could watch the show over and over. Very smart and well written. Wish I could hang with them.

I now own season 1 and 2 of The League and both of them are very funny.  Each season continues to get funnier and funnier and never gets old.  I will buy season 3 when it gets released.  I usually don't buy funny series blu-rays but this series is so funny I can't resist.  Each episode is good and funny, so you will get the most out of this blu-ray.  It is also very good visualy.  I rate this blu-ray with a B.
The league is a great show and i hope that there are many more seasons to come. Funny and able to watch over and over again.

I ordered this product and the arrival time was nice and short. However when I opened the package the plastic wrapping also tore off the plastic cover of the DVD case. Also the DVDs don't exactly play very well. I've tried them in a number of different DVD players but nothing seems to work.
the league what can I say about one of my favorite shows....well calling all fantasy football fans....the show funny with two f s....this DVD geat gift  for someone special on your list..

The League season 2 is just as good as the first season.  The League is once again starting a new fantasy football season in the quest to win the shiva bowl.  Through out the season they start by going to vegas and it all ends with a christmas time adventure.  Many football players make appearances and its comedy is on par as usual.  The video and audio quality of the blu-ray is excellent and has some neat special features. I would strongly recommend you buy this if you Liked the first season.
It arrived quickly and in perfect condition.  I would highly recommend this to anyone.  And you just have to love every minute of the show.
The item was received by promised date, happy with the price and the quality of the product! I am satisfied :)
Would definitely order from this merchant again.  HAD the product IN MY HAND 48 hours after ordering it! Way to go, and thanks for making Christmas for my son!

I love The League!  It's the only show that makes me laugh so hard I almost cry every single episode.  I love it so much, that I bought this season for my brother.  Hell, I want to join a fantasy football league and I'm not even a big fan of football.

My son-in-law had this on his Christmas wish list this year. Since I had gotten him the first season last Christmas, I wanted to make sure he got season 2. I was concerned since last year I had difficulty finding the item and ended up having to make a 2 hour round trip drive to purchase it. I need not have worried this year! I made my purchase quickly and easily. The package came very quickly in perfect condition. Great service!

Season 2 of The League is funny as hell!  Lots of laughs. You don't have to be a guy or into football to like this show. My sister in-law is a huge fan herself.  She enjoys the comedy factor on its own. Anyone who gets this dvd/bluray will have a blast watching all 13 episodes.  Grab a drink and some chips and get ready for hours of fun! Deff a good grab for under $25.00, but wouldnt pay more than $29.

The League is still going strong after 3 years. I almost didn't give it a shot after seeing some of the other garbage that FX put on after earlier seasons of IASIP. This is the real deal, though. Great cast, hilarious characters and story lines - gets me LOLing every episode. This has catapulted over IASIP as one of my favorite comedies on TV.
If you're a fantasy football player, you MUST watch this show.  So funny and so many parallels (yet exaggerated) with real life leagues.
This is the funniest show on TV. I ordered the DVD, it came promply and we enjoyed it very much.

The show continues its very unique humor.  I don't really know what else to compare it to and the show is definitely not for everyone.  But if you liked season 1, you will almost certainly like season 2.

Almost as good as Season 1 of The League, Season 2 manages to remain very entertaining and humorous. If you are a fan of over the top dirty and crass humor this is one for you.  The acting is very solid overall, and the humor seems very spontaneous and genuine in this apparently "semi-scripted" comedy.  If you are not a football fan, they do not spend an inordinate amount of time talking about the intricate details of their fantasy football league.  Overall a very funny, loose-flowing comedy.

The only reason that I continued watching this garbage was because I paid for it.

This was the worst series that I have ever seen, and please note that I have been forced to watch Desperate Housewives and Go Diego Go with my wife and daughter and to tell you the truth, I would have preferred watching the garbage known as the Twilight series than another stupid second of this TV show.

How the hell is it possible that this SHOW is on TV?

The thing that makes the Second Season of The League more infuriating is that Season One had potential and that is why I decided to purchase Season Two, but the writers decided to have a loose bowl movement than to actually THINK of where they wanted to take the characters and the series.

The show was so awful that I needed to vent and write a review, and I do not write reviews.

got these bluray discs fairly quick and in great shape. No complaints.

Thought of buying these at BestBuy but opted to get it at Amazon instead for a great deal.

Thanks...
This season of the league is twice as long and has impressed me every step of the way. Watch out for dirty randy!

The League is seriously one of the funniest shows I've seen on television - it's definitely a must-watch for anyone who plays fantasy football. My husband and I watch this together every week. Season 2 does not disappoint - while the extras aren't anything special, it's great to be able to watch several episodes back to back to get the full effect of Taco, Ruxin (aka Ruspin), Kevin/Jenny, Pete, and Andre.

The season kicks off with hilarity at the Vegas Draft, and has fantastic cameos from players like Ochocinco.

Highly recommended.

This was a great second season of The League, every bit as funny as Season 1!  The Blu-Ray is great quality with lots of great features.  I'd highly recommed for anyone who loves fantasy football and trash-talking with friends!

Funniest show on TV right now, HANDS DOWN.!!! If I could I would give it 6 stars.!! Hilarious character interaction, smart and witty humor. Can be raunchy though, that's what I love about it. These guys rip each other at every opportunity..as good friends should!

Their Fantasy Football Competetive spirit knows no bounaries as they will stoop to any level to, 'one-up' each other(like "trade-raping" ea. other)on their way to the Shiva-Bowl(Their Fantasy-League Superbowl)!

Excellent guest stars from the NFL throughout the series, like Chad "Child-Please" Ochocinco, Ladanian Tomlinson, and Terry Bradshaw, among others. If ur into NFL Football at all, you've got to get this show on DVD..! Best new show in a lonnng time!
I love the early seasons of the League.  This season introduces fan favorite character Rafi and has plenty of great episodes like Kegel the Elf and Expert Witness.
I would have loved this show without Taco.
Product as promised-will do business with again-A+

Funniest show in the history of television. Jumps the shark somewhere middle of the 4th-beginning of 5th season but I'm here to tell you the 1-2-3-4th seasons of this show can hang head-to-head with any other television show ever made.  Season 2 is probably the funniest block of eps this show ever put out- only possibly matched by season 3.

I absolutely love The League. It is a hilarious show about some horrible people with some football thrown in. I watched the entire series multiple times on Netflix and has now been removed. I decided it was time to buy it.
This season was amazing!
Hilarious!
I love this show
Like the series had to own it. Comedy off the cuff. Storylines are not tight so just have fun with the presentation.
Great show! Super funny. If you're into comedy & football - this show is a no brainer.
